location_description: Scaffolding area on a construction site

hazards.description: A worker explicitly states, "that plank doesn't look tied in," referring to a plank on the scaffolding platform. Another worker mentions a "gap right there." This indicates that the working platform is not fully decked or planks are not secured, creating a significant fall hazard for workers on the platform.
recommended_actions: Immediately stop all work on the affected scaffolding until a competent person inspects and certifies its safety.
Ensure all scaffolding planks are properly secured, fully decked, and free of gaps.
Verify that guardrails are properly installed and maintained on all open sides of the platform.
Provide refresher training on scaffolding safety, including proper planking and securing procedures.

hazards.description: Workers are operating on an elevated scaffolding platform with identified unsecured planks and gaps, significantly increasing the risk of a fall from height.
recommended_actions: Ensure all working platforms are fully decked and planks are secured.
Verify that guardrails are properly installed and maintained.
Ensure workers are using personal fall arrest systems if required and tied off correctly.

hazards.description: Workers are handling a long wooden plank on an elevated scaffolding platform. The presence of an unsecured plank on the platform itself, combined with the movement of materials, creates a risk of objects falling from height and striking workers or equipment below.
recommended_actions: Establish and enforce an exclusion zone below areas where overhead work is being performed.
Ensure all materials and tools on elevated platforms are secured to prevent accidental displacement or drops.
Install toe boards on all working platforms to contain loose materials.

hazards.description: Workers are aware of an unsecured plank and a gap on the scaffolding platform but continue to move a large wooden plank without immediately addressing the identified hazards. One worker is also walking backward while carrying the plank, which increases the risk of tripping or losing balance.
recommended_actions: Implement a 'stop work' policy that empowers workers to halt operations immediately when a safety hazard is identified until it is mitigated.
Provide training on hazard identification, risk assessment, and the importance of immediate corrective action.
Reinforce safe material handling practices, including maintaining clear sightlines and avoiding walking backward when carrying loads.
